Observing the natural world is the only way we can hope to understand it.
Questioning why things are the way they are is the first step towards understanding them.
Several possible explanations are almost always available.
Each explanation offers different predictions about the future.
Testing predictions can rule out invalid ideas.
Well-supported, general explanations change our understanding of the world.
Sharing knowledge is a great way to refine it further.
If an experiment is run again and gives a different answer, maybe the idea is wrong.
